programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Capitals oppose the Lightning in the Sunshine State. Tampa Bay went beyond 65 minutes to secure a 2-1 win over Washington on Dec. 23, 2023. Victor Hedman assisted on the Bolts' lone goal in regulation, and snapped home the shootout winner.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bruins (20-5, 9-5) and Utes (19-7, 9-5) jockey for position in a crowded Pac-12 picture. Junior guard Kennady McQueen scored eight of her 21 points in overtime as Utah dumped then-No. 2 UCLA 94-81 on Jan. 22. Utah has won four of its last five.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Fighting Irish pay a visit to the Orange. Notre Dame has pulled itself out of the ACC's basement with three straight wins after a 72-50 victory at Louisville on Feb. 21. Syracuse upset then-No. 7 North Carolina in its last home contest Feb. 13.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Demon Deacons (17-9, 9-6 ACC) take another shot at the No. 8 Blue Demons (21-5, 12-3). Duke's five-game win streak includes a 77-69 victory over Wake Forest on Feb. 12. Mark Mitchell led Duke with 23 points, while Kyle Filipowski double-doubled.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Virginia continues its pursuit of top spot in the ACC when it hosts conference-leading No. 10 North Carolina. In 2022-23, the Cavaliers went 2-1 against the Tar Heels, and ended UNC's season with a 68-59 verdict in the ACC Tournament's quarterfinals.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 9 Kansas gets its first chance at revenge against Texas in this Saturday showcase. On March 11, 2023, the Longhorns breezed past the Jayhawks 76-56 to capture their second Big 12 crown in three years. Kansas has won 18 consecutive home dates.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Volunteers try to return fire against the Aggies. On Feb. 10, Tyrece Radford and Wade Taylor IV combined for 52 points and 12 assists in Texas A&M's 85-69 triumph over then-No. 6 Tennessee. The Vols have won five of their last six.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: The No. 6 Cyclones (20-6, 9-4 Big 12) look to bounce back as they host the Mountaineers (9-17, 4-9). West Virginia has won eight of the last nine meetings after sweeping a pair in 2022-23. Iowa State's four-game win streak was snapped Feb. 19.

programme.desc: The Sooners (18-8, 6-7 Big 12) attempt to sweep this season's Bedlam Series against the Cowboys (12-14, 4-9). Oklahoma has dropped two in a row since taking down Oklahoma State 66-62 on Feb. 10. Quion Williams (OKST) double-doubled in the loss.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Thundering Herd field a challenge from the Mountaineers in a Sun Belt affair. Appalachian State's 73-58 victory on Feb. 15 was its first over Marshall since the 2010 CIT postseason tournament quarterfinals following the Herd's sweep in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 21 Cougars face the Sun Devils. Washington State has won three in a row on the road, and has not lost in regulation away from home in 2024. Arizona State beat Oregon State 79-61 at home Feb. 14. The schools split their last two season series.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Broncos try for their first season-series sweep of the Bulldogs since 1995-96. On Jan. 11, Santa Clara pulled off a stunning 77-76 upset of then-No. 23 Gonzaga, ending a 26-game drought. Adama Bal scored the winning basket and totaled 17 points.

The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
